question_content.barrons:question: According to the passage, fascist dictatorships differ from monarchies of recent times in

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: setting limits to their scope of action

question_content.barrons:explanation:
eradicating all potential opposition.

The final sentence states that the fascist dictatorships "destroyed all forms of social organization that were in any way rivals to the state." In doing so, they were eradicating all potential opposition.

Setting limits to their scope of action is incorrect. Social classes, such as the feudal nobility in England, and organized corporations, such as the guilds and trade unions, were able to set limits to their respective governmentâ€™s scope of action. The fascist dictatorships set no such limits on their powers.

Enjoying economic power and popular support is incorrect. Nothing in the passage indicates that fascist dictatorships differ from monarchies in enjoying economic power and popular support.

Rivaling the state in power is incorrect. It is unsupported by the passage.

Defending itself from arbitrary rulings is incorrect. It is unsupported by the passage.
